answers.answer: Thyronorm - thyroid meds.   (Guess your doctor thinks you are hypothyroid)obestat - It works by decreasing your appetite for weight loss.flovite - Used to treat or prevent folic acid deficiency. It is a B complex vitaminglumet - Used to treat type 2 (noninsulin-dependent) diabetes (formerly "adult-onset").strovas -  ?ostocalcium - Calciumcosadex - (biculatamide) is a prostate cancer treatment introduced in 1995, and it's available as a prostate cancer drug treatment in most of the world. it also has a severe anti-androgen effect and drastically limits the production of testosterone in the adrenal glands and testes, as well as the action of testosterone at cellular receptor sites.revital - balanced combination of vitamins, minerals and ginseng. Ginseng is a herbal extract, commonly used for added energy and well being.
Thankyou. I am really greatful to you . If someone has any other interpretation or suggestion please help.

What exactly do you want in interpretation and what suggestion are you looking for - can't read your mind. Surely you asked the doctor?  Plus it would help if you'd list Lab thyroid reference ranges.Everything else looks good. Nothing way out for concern.GL
A doctor has suggested Strovas to my mom too. We were told this was to reduce bad cholesterol. Hope it helps

question: am an indian 36 year old female 168cm height and weighing 78 kilos.I have gained 20 kgs ove the last 2 years.. suffer from infrequent depression.. have lost interest in a zestful life, dont want to look at myself in a mirror . dont buy new clothes as the old sizes dont fit me any more. result eat more...have been to an endocriniologist the test results as below.ResultFree T3 - 2.35pg/ml, Free T4 0.79ng/dl, TSH 3.42(meu)IU/mlC reative protine 1.32Homocysteine 15.3 (meu)mol.l, Fasting Glucose 104 mg/dlHbA1c 6.57%Colestrol 222 mg/dlHDLCholestrol 39mg/dlLDL Cholestrol 151 mg/dlVLDL Cholestrol 32 mg /dltriglycerides 160 mgMedicines prescribedThyronorm, obestat, flovite, glumet strovas,ostocalcium,cosadex,revitalwhat does this mean?
title: Weight gain depression, tests done...
